member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer
member.summary: The buffer for Receive using byte ArraySegment

member.name: F:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer._readPtr
member.summary: Pointer of reading in the buffer

member.name: F:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer._writePtr
member.summary: Pointer of writing in the buffer

member.name: P:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.DataSize
member.summary: Get size of written data.

member.name: P:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.FreeSize
member.summary: Get writable size of the buffer now.

member.name: P:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.DataSegment
member.summary: Return the byte segment of the written data.

member.name: P:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.WriteSegment
member.summary: Return the writable byte segment.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.CleanUp
member.summary: Pulls the data to the front of the buffer and cleans it up. (Free up space of buffer)

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.ClearBuffer
member.summary: Reset the buffer.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.OnRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the read pointer of the recvbuffer.
member.param: The length of bytes to check the data.
member.returns:
False if the numOfBytes is bigger than current data size.
True, otherwise.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.RecvBuffer.OnWrite(System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the write pointer of the recvbuffer.
member.param: The length of bytes to check the data.
member.returns:
False if the numOfBytes is bigger than current-writable size.
True, otherwise.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.SendBufferTLS
member.summary:
Each thread sends data with this.
It has SendBuffer in Thread-Local-Storage.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.SendBufferTLS.Reserve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper method of SendBuffer.Reserve

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.SendBufferTLS.Return(System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper method of SendBuffer.Return

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.SendBuffer
member.summary: The buffer for Send using byte array.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.SendBuffer.Reserve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a segment which can be used of the size of reserveSize.
member.returns: If there is no enough size to reserve, returns null.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.SendBuffer.Return(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the used segment actually after calling Reserve.
member.returns: The segment of the actually used buffer.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.SendBuffer.Use(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Return the segment with that size. (reserve + return)
If there is not enough size, returns the segment after setting usedSize 0.
member.returns: The segment of the buffer with the size.

member.name: F:ServerCoreTCP.Defines.PACKET_HEADER_SIZE
member.summary: The size of packet body: sizeof(ushort).

member.name: F:ServerCoreTCP.Defines.SessionSendFlushMinIntervalMilliseconds
member.summary: It can be changed by user.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Core.Global
member.summary:
The class that contains global members in Core.
It will be initialized when the service starts.
Some members can be used in user-codes.

member.name: F:ServerCoreTCP.Core.Global.G_Stopwatch
member.summary: JobTimer and PacketSession uses this stopwatch globally.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Core.Global.Init
member.summary: It will be called when the service starts.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.ActionSerializer
member.summary:
This is ActionSerilizer class for executing actions in one thread.
If you want to user parameters, use IJobSerializer.
It need to be called `Flush()` manually.
When `Flush()` called, the it will invoke all actions in the queue.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.ActionSerializerAuto
member.summary:
This is ActionSerializerAuto class for executing actions in one thread.
If you want to user parameters, use IJobSerializerAuto.
When `Add()` called, it will begin to invoke actions in the queue if any thread is not flushing.
At this time, other `Add()` can be called and it just adds a action to a queue.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.ICancelable
member.summary: The interface of cancelable job.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.CancelableJob
member.summary:
The cancelable job object which is used in JobTimer.
Set `Canceled` to false when you want to cancel to invoke this job.

member.name: P:ServerCoreTCP.Job.CancelableJob.Canceled
member.summary: Set this value to false if you want to cancel to invoke this job.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJob
member.summary: The interface of Job.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.Job
member.summary:
The job object which is used in JobSerialier and JobTimer.
Up to 5 arguments are provided.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJobSerializer
member.summary: The interface of JobSerializer.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJobSerializer.Flush
member.summary: Invokes all jobs in the queue.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJobSerializer.Add(ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJob)
member.summary: Add job to serializer.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.JobSerializer
member.summary:
This is JobSerilizer class for executing jobs in one thread with serializing the jobs.
It need to be called `Flush()` manually.
When `Flush()` called, it will invoke all actions in the queue.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.JobSerializerWithTimer
member.summary:
This is JobSerilizer class for executing jobs in one thread with serializing the jobs.
It calls `Flush()` automatically, so you don't need to call `Flush()` manually.
The added cancelable jobs are executed when the reserved time comes. (miiliseconds)
It contains the whole functions of JobSerializer. (It is derived from JobSerializer)

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.IUseJobTimer
member.summary: The interface of the JobTimer using Cancelable jobs.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Job.JobTimer
member.summary:
It is stored in the priority queue at the scheduled time, and when that time comes, it is automatically flushed and the job is executed.
If the Canceled value of the job is false, the job will not be executed.
It uses the StopWatch in Global.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Job.JobTimer.AddAfter(ServerCoreTCP.Job.IJob,System.Int64)
member.summary: Add Cancelable Job in the queue.
member.param: The reserved time to be executed

member.summary: Logger can be created with 'CreateLoggerWithFlag' or user's needs in directly.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.CLogger.LoggerConfig
member.summary: The default values are from the default values of LoggerConfiguration, and the defualt encoding is UTF8.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.CLogger.LoggerHelper.GetFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return a filename based on DateTime.Now.
member.param: The root directory of the file.
The extension of log file. e.g. log, txt, ...

member.summary: Note: Send/Recv can be occurred in multiple threads

member.summary:
Called when the socket is connected.

member.summary:
Check the received buffer.
If there are multiple packet data on the buffer, each data is processed separately.
OnRecv will be called here.

member.summary: A session must be initialized with this method with socket.

member.summary: Send a list of data to endpoint of the socket. [ArraySegment]
member.param: A list of serialized data to send

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Session.RegisterSend
member.summary:
Reserve 'Send' for async-send.
Note: It needs to be protected for race-condition.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Session.RegisterRecv
member.summary: Reserve 'Receive' for async-receive

member.summary: Callback that is called when recv-operation is completed.

Close the connection and the socket and clear the session.
If it is in ServerService, returns the session to the pool.

member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Utils.PriorityQueue`1
member.summary:
PriorityQueue (If the type is numeric, Peek() will return highest value in default.)
NOTE: If count==0, `Peek()` and `Dequeue()` will return DEFAULT value.
Use `TryPeek` and `TryDequeue` safely with primitive types.

member.summary: The main task does not contain infite-loop for the action.

member.summary: Add a new task that invokes the action infinitely with options of LongRunning.

member.name: T:ServerCoreTCP.Utils.ThreadManager
member.summary: It uses Thread directly and is recommended in Debug mode for identifying the thread names.

member.summary: The taskCount does not contains the main task.
member.param: The task count except main task.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Utils.ThreadManager.SetMainTask(System.Action,System.String)
member.summary: Do not change the thread name before or after calling this function.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Utils.ThreadManager.AddTask(System.Action,System.String)
member.summary: Do not change the thread name before or after calling this function.

member.name: M:ServerCoreTCP.Utils.ThreadManager.StartTasks
member.summary: Start all registered tasks. NOTE: Each task will invoke repeatedly with `Thread.Sleep(0)` in infinite loop at each thread, but the main task will be called only invoke once.
